definitions.definition: A person who is not a citizen of the Union and does not enjoy the right to free movement under Union law.
A person not considered a national by any State under the operation of its law.
A third-country national or stateless person who has made an application for international protection pending a final decision.
A request for protection seeking refugee or subsidiary protection status.
Defined in Regulation 2024/1347: a person with a well‑founded fear of persecution for specific grounds.
Defined in Regulation 2024/1347: faces real risk of serious harm if returned.
A person granted refugee or subsidiary protection status.
Person benefiting from temporary protection as defined in Eurodac Regulation.
A person accepted for admission under Resettlement Regulation or national resettlement scheme.
Spouse/partner, minor child, or parent/adult responsible for a minor applicant or beneficiary.
Adult aunt/uncle or grandparent.
A person below the age of 18 years.
A minor arriving without an adult responsible, or left unaccompanied after arrival.
A person/organisation appointed to assist an unaccompanied minor.

definitions.term: Applicant in need of special procedural guarantees
definitions.definition: Applicant with limited ability to benefit from procedure due to individual circumstances.
Assessment of admissibility or merits, excluding responsibility determination.
Decision no longer subject to remedy or final under national law.
Explicit or implicit withdrawal of an application or protection.
A new application after a final decision on a previous one.
The Member State responsible per Regulation 2024/1351.
Arrivals of such scale that they create disproportionate obligations on a Member State.
Cumulative arrivals causing system capacity to be reached.
As defined in Schengen Borders Code.
Not remaining available to authorities under defined conditions.
Risk based on objective criteria in national law.
As defined in the 1979 Hamburg Convention.
Fingerprint data, facial image data, or both.
Captured fingerprints used for comparison.
Images used for biometric comparison.
All biometric/alphanumeric data stored in Eurodac.
A biometric match within Eurodac.
A set of biometric, identity or alphanumeric data in Eurodac.
Personal identity details stored in CIR/Eurodac.
Common Identity Repository established by Regulation 2019/818.
Authorisation to stay, excluding visas and temporary permits during assessment.
Authorisation for transit or intended stay.
Qualification obtained after ≥1 academic year in a recognised Member State programme.
Recognised public/private institution providing education or training.
Person appointed under Regulation 2024/1351.
Member State receiving solidarity contributions.
Member State providing solidarity contributions.
Designated channel for Eurodac queries.
Europol’s designated Eurodac access channel.
Agency responsible for operational management of Eurodac.
Capacity required for asylum/return border procedures.
Defined per Regulation 2024/1347: fear of persecution on protected grounds
Faces real risk of serious harm per Regulation 2024/1347
Recognition as refugee
Recognition as subsidiary protection beneficiary
Refugee or subsidiary protection status
Person under 18 years
Minor without adult responsible
Decision no longer challengeable under Chapter V
Assessment of admissibility or merits
As defined in Regulation 2024/1358
Capacity needed for border procedures
Request for protection
Person with pending application
Applicant with limited ability to comply
Not considered national by any State
Body responsible for examining applications
Revocation or refusal to renew protection
Right to remain on territory/border/transit zones
Application after final decision
State responsible under Regulation 2024/1351
Person applying for refugee/subsidiary protection
Person registered under resettlement procedures

definitions.term: person admitted under national resettlement scheme
definitions.definition: Person admitted through national resettlement pathway
National protection equivalent to international protection standards
State transmitting data to Eurodac
Person who is not EU citizen
Presence on territory without meeting legal entry/residence conditions
Refugee or subsidiary protection holder
Person under temporary protection regime
Biometric match in Eurodac
Designated national interface for Eurodac queries
Europol's interface for Eurodac queries
Agency managing Eurodac
Biometric and alphanumeric stored datasets
Offences under Framework Decision 2002/584/JHA
Offences under Directive 2017/541
Biometric fingerprint information
Biometric facial imagery
Fingerprints and/or facial images
Names, dates of birth and other text data
Authorisation to stay
Stored personal identity information
Common Identity Repository
A complete record for an individual in Eurodac
Person below age 18
A person who is not an EU citizen and not enjoying free movement rights
A person not considered a national by any State
A request for protection seeking refugee or subsidiary protection
A person who has made such an application and awaits final decision
Examination of admissibility or merits excluding responsibility procedures
Explicit or implicit withdrawal of an application
Person granted protection under Regulation 2024/1347
Spouse/partner; minor child; parent or adult responsible for minor
Adult aunt/uncle or grandparent
A person below 18 years
A minor arriving without an adult responsible
Person or organisation assisting an unaccompanied minor
Authorisation to stay, excluding visas and temporary permits
Authorisation for transit or intended stay
Qualification obtained after ≥1 academic year in a Member State programme
Recognised education or vocational institution
Failure to remain available to competent authorities
Objective reasons to believe a person may abscond
State benefitting from solidarity contributions
State providing solidarity contributions
Implementation of a decision under Article 42
Transfer from benefitting to contributing Member State
Operations under the 1979 Hamburg Convention
Arrivals causing disproportionate obligations on a Member State
Cumulative arrivals reaching system limits
Defined in Directive 2024/1346
Person accepted under Resettlement Regulation or national scheme
Coordinator appointed under Article 15
Request for protection made to a Member State by a third‑country national or stateless person understood to be seeking refugee or subsidiary protection status.
A third‑country national or stateless person who has made an application for international protection that has not yet received a final decision.

Where the family existed before arrival and is present in the same Member State during the procedure: (a) spouse or unmarried partner treated as equivalent to spouse; (b) minor or adult dependent children of the couple or of the applicant (unmarried); (c) where the applicant is a minor and unmarried, the father, mother or another adult responsible (including an adult sibling).
A third‑country national or stateless person below 18 years of age.
A minor arriving unaccompanied by an adult responsible (by law or practice) and not effectively taken into such care, including a minor left unaccompanied after entry.
The full set of measures that Member States grant to applicants under the Directive.
Reception conditions including housing, food, clothing and personal hygiene products provided in kind, as financial allowances, in vouchers or a combination, as well as a daily expenses allowance.
Allowance provided periodically (monetary, vouchers, in kind or a combination) that includes a monetary amount to enable a minimum degree of autonomy in daily life.
Confinement of an applicant by a Member State within a particular place where the person is deprived of freedom of movement.
Any place used for the collective housing of applicants.
Specific reasons and circumstances in an individual case, based on objective criteria defined by national law, to believe that an applicant might abscond.

Action by which an applicant does not remain available to competent administrative or judicial authorities, such as by leaving the Member State’s territory without permission, for reasons not beyond the applicant’s control.

Natural person or organisation (including a public authority) appointed with necessary skills and expertise to represent, assist and act on behalf of an unaccompanied minor to safeguard the child’s best interests and well‑being and to enable the child to benefit from rights and comply with obligations under the Directive.
An applicant who needs special conditions or guarantees in order to benefit from the rights and comply with the obligations under the Directive.

euaa_guidelines.title: Practical Guide on Registration and Lodging of Applications
euaa_guidelines.description: Assists officers in daily work to register applications for international protection and supports officers responsible for lodging applications.

euaa_guidelines.title: Practical Guide on Free Legal Counselling
euaa_guidelines.description: Guidance for design of national systems of free legal counselling within CEAS framework.

euaa_guidelines.title: Practical Guide on Information Provision in the Asylum Procedure
euaa_guidelines.description: Supports information providers during the asylum procedure with methodological guidance.

euaa_guidelines.title: Practical Guide on Evidence and Risk Assessment
euaa_guidelines.description: Comprehensive methodology on gathering information, credibility assessment, and risk assessment.

euaa_guidelines.title: Practical Guide on Audio Recording of Personal Interviews
euaa_guidelines.description: Guidance on setting up fit-for-purpose process for audio recording of personal interviews.

euaa_guidelines.title: Practical Guide on Membership of a Particular Social Group
euaa_guidelines.description: Assistance in applying the persecution ground of membership of particular social group.

euaa_guidelines.title: Guidance on Remote Interviews
euaa_guidelines.description: Guidance on remote interviews in context of asylum procedure and migration management regulations.

euaa_guidelines.title: Practical Guide on Nationality
euaa_guidelines.description: Explains concepts of nationality and statelessness and implications for international protection assessment.

euaa_guidelines.title: Practical Guide on SOGIESC - Examination Procedure
euaa_guidelines.description: Guidance on examining applications with SOGIESC-based claims (sexual orientation, gender identity, expression, sex characteristics).

euaa_guidelines.title: Practical Guide on Interpretation in the Asylum Procedure
euaa_guidelines.description: Informs interpreters on their role, key principles, and guidance on interpreting in line with international standards.

euaa_guidelines.title: Practical Guide on Qualification for International Protection
euaa_guidelines.description: Assists case officers in examining applications and applying legal criteria for refugee status and subsidiary protection.

euaa_guidelines.title: Guidance on the Dublin Procedure
euaa_guidelines.description: Operational standards and indicators for implementing Dublin III Regulation in harmonised way.

euaa_guidelines.title: Practical Guide on Family Tracing - Part I
euaa_guidelines.description: Supports EU+ countries in tracing family members of unaccompanied children in line with best interests.

euaa_guidelines.title: Practical Guide on Family Tracing - Part II
euaa_guidelines.description: Supports case officers in prioritisation of family cases under asylum and migration management regulation.

euaa_guidelines.title: Practical Guide on Exclusion for Serious Crimes
euaa_guidelines.description: Explains constitutive elements of serious non-political crimes exclusion ground.

euaa_guidelines.title: Practical Guide on Quality Assurance in Asylum Procedures
euaa_guidelines.description: Supports asylum administrations to implement quality assurance methodology and develop quality management systems.

euaa_guidelines.title: Operational Standards and Indicators on the Asylum Procedure
euaa_guidelines.description: Practical tool to support Member States achieve fair and effective asylum procedures and strengthen CEAS.

euaa_guidelines.title: Operational Standards on Vulnerability-related Aspects
euaa_guidelines.description: Standards and indicators for applicants in vulnerable situations with theoretical introduction to vulnerability.

euaa_guidelines.title: Guidance on Contingency Planning and Preparedness
euaa_guidelines.description: Operational standards on contingency planning to help EU+ countries build or review national contingency plans.

euaa_guidelines.title: Practical Guide on the Management of a Reception Centre
euaa_guidelines.description: Supports national administrations in implementing key aspects of collective reception centres management.

euaa_guidelines.title: Guidelines on Alternatives to Detention
euaa_guidelines.description: Guidelines on defining, establishing, deciding, implementing, reviewing and ending alternatives to detention.

euaa_guidelines.title: Practical Guide on SOGIESC - Reception
euaa_guidelines.description: Guidance on reception conditions for applicants with diverse SOGIESC.

euaa_guidelines.title: Country Guidance: Syria
euaa_guidelines.description: Member States' joint assessment of situation in Syria following fall of Assad regime.

euaa_guidelines.title: Country Guidance: Iran
euaa_guidelines.description: Latest update of Country Guidance on Iran with common analysis and guidance.

euaa_guidelines.title: Country Guidance: Explained
euaa_guidelines.description: General guidance and methodological framework for EUAA country guidance documents.

euaa_guidelines.title: Self-Assessment Tool on Quality of the Asylum Procedure
euaa_guidelines.description: IT solution facilitating efficient self-assessment of quality of asylum procedures.

euaa_guidelines.title: Asylum Report 2025
euaa_guidelines.description: Overview of key developments in asylum in 2024, summarising changes to policies, practice and laws.
